availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alpheus Palmer (Christian County, Kentucky, carpenter and farmer.)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, carpenter and farmer. Connecticut native. Married to Obedience Cavender Palmer in Christian County, Kentucky, on April 20, 1824. Resident of Christian County, Kentucky, in 1830. Owned three enslaved persons in Christian County 1830. Resident of Christian County in 1840. Owned five enslaved persons in Christian County in 1840. Carpenter in Christian County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Christian County 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Christian County in 1860.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, Film 001942963, p. 62.
Anne Allen Fleming and Betty Allen McCorkle, Riverside Cemetery: Hopkinsville, Kentucky, 1867-1997, (Melber, KY: Simmons Historical Publications, 1998), p. 225.
